metadata.label: Description
metadata.value:
Uncolored engraved double page map of California, Baja California the Southwestern U.S.
   Includes decorative title cartouche. Shows the coast of California, cities, towns, landmarks,
   rivers and mountains. Relief shown pictorially.

metadata.label: Citation/reference
metadata.value: Philip Burden, The Mapping of North America, p. 125-132.

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: David Rumsey Map Collection at Stanford University Libraries

items.description:

items.label: DESCRIPTIO INDIÆ OCCIDENTALIS Per Antonium de Herrera Regium Indiarum et Castellæ Historiographum
items.attribution: This work has been identified as being free of known restrictions under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: DESCRIPTIO INDIÆ OCCIDENTALIS Per Antonium de Herrera Regium Indiarum et Castellæ Historiographum

metadata.label: Format
metadata.value: 28.3 x 19 cm., with map 10.5 x 14.5 cm. including scrollwork border.

metadata.label: Publications
metadata.value: Map on 2nd title page of: Descriptio Indiae Occidentalis / per Antonium de Herrera Regium Indiarum et Castellæ Historiographum. Issued with Dutch first title page of: Nievve vverelt, anders ghenaempt vvest-Indien / By Michiel Colijn. -- t’Amsterdam, anno 1622. Issued with French first title page of: Description des Indes Occidentales, qu’on appelle aujourdhuy le novveav monde / Par Antoine de Herrera. -- A Amsterdam : Chez Emanvel Colin ... et ... à Paris Chez Michel Soly ..., anno M.D.C.XXII [1622].

metadata.label: State 1
metadata.value: In French, without text on verso.

metadata.label: State 2
metadata.value: In Latin, with text on verso: Extraict dv privilege de Messieurs les Estats Generaux des Provinces Unies...

metadata.label: State 3
metadata.value: 1623, in German, with a slightly slimmer California and several changes to title page: figure of Magellanus and medallion of Christophorvs Colvmbvs to left of map, and figure of Franciscus Pisardu and medallion of Americvs Vespvtivs to right of map; top center crest is reduced in size and surrounded by more decorative artwork; center contains much text within border; no text on verso; and no oak-leaf border on title page. 29.1 x 19.1 cm.

metadata.label: State 4
metadata.value: [1624], with oak-leaf border, otherwise identical with 1622 issue. Text on verso: Svmma privilegii... 28.3 x 19.1 cm. including border.

metadata.label: State 5
metadata.value: 1624, in Latin, figure of Magellanus and medallion of Christophorvs Colvmbvs to left of map, and figure of Franciscus Pisardu and medallion of Americvs Vespvtivs to right of map; top center crest is reduced in size and surrounded by more decorative artwork; center contains much text within border; no text on verso; and no oak-leaf border on title page. 29.1 x 19.1 cm.

metadata.label: References
metadata.value: Wagner 291; Wagner/Sp. SW 12a; Tooley/107 (Plate 15); Leighly 1; Nordenskiöld 3,970 and 971; Burden 195 (Plate 195) and 200 (Plate 200); Church 173 and 199.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: The earliest representation of California as a large island on map of Western Hemisphere on bottom half of title page. No place names.Title center page with crest above and 8 illustrations of native gods, figures and structures on sides. Map following [page]2 shows California as a peninsula.

metadata.label: Identifier
metadata.value: Original McLaughlin Book Number (1995 edition): TP1

metadata.label: Identifier
metadata.value: Original McLaughlin book number (1995 edition) with latest state information: TP1-02

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: The Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island

items.description: The earliest representation of California as a large island on map of Western Hemisphere on bottom half of title page. No place names.Title center page with crest above and 8 illustrations of native gods, figures and structures on sides. Map following [page]2 shows California as a peninsula.

items.label: The North part of America conteyning Newfoundland, New England, Virginia, Florida, New Spaine and Nova Francia, with ye riche Iles of Hispaniola, Cuba, Jamaica, and Porto Rieco, on the south, and upon ye west the large and goodly island of California
items.attribution: This work has been identified as being free of known restrictions under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: The North part of America conteyning Newfoundland, New England, Virginia, Florida, New Spaine and Nova Francia, with ye riche Iles of Hispaniola, Cuba, Jamaica, and Porto Rieco, on the south, and upon ye west the large and goodly island of California

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: The first printed map in English to show California as an island, with flat northern coast.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Cities, etc. ; shoals; pictorial symbols; notes.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Notes on map refer to California, Sr. Thomas Button and Mr. Baffin.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: "852" & "853" inside neat line in top left & right corners of map.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Engraved by: R. Elstrake Sculpsit (lower right).

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: On the map are two notes, one stating"California sometymes supposed to be a part of ye westerne continent, but scince by a Spanish Charte taken by ye Hollanders it is found to be a goodly Ilande: the length of the west shoare beeing about 500 leagues..."

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Issued in: Hakluytus Posthumus or Purchas His Pilgrimes, III, 852-3. London, 1625, to accompany an article by H. Briggs on the Northwest Passage.

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: The Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island

items.description: The first printed map in English to show California as an island, with flat northern coast.

items.label: AMERICA with those known parts in that unknowne worlde both people and manner of buildings Discribed and inlarged by I.S.Ano.1626
items.attribution: This work has been identified as being free of known restrictions under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: AMERICA with those known parts in that unknowne worlde both people and manner of buildings Discribed and inlarged by I.S.Ano.1626

metadata.label: Format
metadata.value: 35.2 x 43.7 cm., 39.5 x 51.2 cm. including border.

metadata.label: State 1
metadata.value: 1626, "Are to be sold in pops-head alley against the Exchange by G. Humble, 1626". Issued in his: A prospect of the most famous parts of the world . -- London : G. Humble, 1627. Reissued in the 1631 edition with no changes to map but changed text on verso. Reissued 1646, 1650-54.

metadata.label: State 2
metadata.value: 1662, with the town of Boston in New England, Connecticut, Maryland and Long Island are added to the plate and a dotted boundary placed round Delaware and Hudsons Rio. The text on verso has unchanged content but the type is reset and now commences with a historiated capital A, a new fleuron heading and the page number 9 restored top right.

metadata.label: State 3
metadata.value: 1662, with imprint changed from G. Humble to: Are to be sold by Roger Rea ye Elder and younger at ye Golden Cross in Cornhill against ye Exchange.

metadata.label: State 4
metadata.value: [1676], "are to be sold by Thomas Bassett in Fleet Street, and by Richard Chiswell in St. Paul's Churchyard." The text on verso is rewritten and there is no fleuron heading. Map is still dated 1626. Issued in his: The Theatre of Great Britaine, London, 1676.

metadata.label: References
metadata.value: LC 442 and 488; Wagner 301b; Wheat 39; Tooley 2, 3, 4, 5 (Plate 27); Leighly 6 (Plate IV); UCB; Goss (Plate 25); Burden 217 (Plate 217); Clancy (Map 7.6).

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: California with flat northern coast and with place names mostly taken from Brigg's map. Inset: The northerly part of America (upper left). The borders of the map on the top contain plans of towns and on the sides figures of the inhabitants of different countries. Text on verso paged 9 and 10. Engraved by: Abraham Goos Amstelodamiensis Sculpsit (lower right).

metadata.label: Identifier
metadata.value: Original McLaughlin book number (1995 edition) with latest state information: 3-01

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: The Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island

items.description: California with flat northern coast and with place names mostly taken from Brigg's map. Inset: The northerly part of America (upper left). The borders of the map on the top contain plans of towns and on the sides figures of the inhabitants of different countries. Text on verso paged 9 and 10. Engraved by: Abraham Goos Amstelodamiensis Sculpsit (lower right).

items.label: AUDIENCE DE GUADALAJARA, NOUVEAU MEXIQUE, CALIFORNIE, &c.
items.attribution: This work has been identified as being free of known restrictions under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: AUDIENCE DE GUADALAJARA, NOUVEAU MEXIQUE, CALIFORNIE, &c.

metadata.label: Format
metadata.value: 1 map : hand col.; 20.5 x 22.4 cm., 20.5 x 24 cm. including border.

metadata.label: State 1
metadata.value: [1656], in French, with imprint 'A Paris chez P. Mariette rue S. Iacques a l'Esperance Avec Pri. pour 20 ans'. Manuscript '63' (top right, outside map border).

metadata.label: State 2
metadata.value: 1657, with changed imprint: Par N. Sanson d'Abbeville Geogr. ordin' du Roy. Avecq Privilege pour 20 Ans. 1657.

metadata.label: State 3
metadata.value: In French, with 'Par N. Sanson d'Abbeville Geogr Ordin du Roy' imprint. Otherwise identical with 1st and 2nd states. Undated

metadata.label: State 4
metadata.value: In Latin, [1657?], entitled: Audienca de Guadalajara, Nova Mexico California &c. / Per N. Sanson. California labelled California Insula. Title cartouche smaller, of scrollwork instead of wings.

metadata.label: State 5
metadata.value: In Dutch, 1665, 1683, 1705, 1715, entitled: 'T gebiedt van Guadalajara, Niew Mexico, en Californie enz. / door N. Sanson d'Abbeville Geogr Ordin du Roy. Mountains shown pictorially on mainland, place names unchanged from French editions, but with Nouvelle Albion labelled on California's north. Issued in his: L'Amerique en plusieurs cartes nouvelles et exactes, et en divers traittez de graphie & d'histoire... , Utrecht, following p.26,[1683]. Issued in: Algeemeene Weereld-Beschreibung ... / Pherotee De La Croix. -- Amsterdam : Francois Halma, 1705.

metadata.label: State 6
metadata.value: In French, with Guadalajara now spelled Guadalaiara in title cartouche, and 'Par N. Sanson d'Abb Geogr. Ordin du Roy' imprint. Otherwise identical with Dutch issue (state 5). Issued in: Atlas portatif, [Map]271 / du Sauzet. Issued in: America explored, [p.145] / Adrian Johnson

metadata.label: State 7
metadata.value: In German, entitled: Audience de Guadalajara, Nova Mexico California &c. / Per N. Sanson. Issued in: Die Gantze Erd-Kugel Bestehend In ... Europa, Asia, Africa, Und America, [1679].

metadata.label: State 8
metadata.value: In French, with mountains above Apache. Entitled: Audience de Guadalajara, Nouveau Mexique, Californie, &c. / Par N. Sanson d’Abbeville Geogr Ordin du Roy. Otherwise identical with Dutch issue (state 5). Issued in: Description de tout L’Universe… / Par Mrs. Sanson Pere & Fils. – A Amsterdam : Francois Halma, M.D.CC. (1700).

metadata.label: References
metadata.value: Wheat 54; Tooley 15; Leighly 28 (Plate IX); BN Sanson II A(5), Sanson II F(5) & Sanson VII E; Ashley Baynton-Williams, correspondence, 1995; UCB; Americana Catalog No. 54, Richard Fitch “Old maps & prints & books”, Item #30.

metadata.label: Statement of responsibility
metadata.value: Par N. Sanson d'Abbeville Geogr. ordin' du Roy.

metadata.label: Publications
metadata.value: Reissued 1657, 1662, 1676, 1683, 1696, 1699.Issued in his: L'Amerique en plusieurs cartes nouvelles et exactes, et en divers traittez de graphie & d'histoire... , Paris, 1657.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: California as an island, labelled California Isle, and with indented northern coastline and many place names. Agubela de Cato to north. Winged title cartouche. (upper right).

metadata.label: Identifier
metadata.value: Original McLaughlin book number (1995 edition) with latest state information: 16-01

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: The Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island

items.description: California as an island, labelled California Isle, and with indented northern coastline and many place names. Agubela de Cato to north. Winged title cartouche. (upper right).

metadata.label: Description

metadata.label: Description

metadata.label: Description

items.label: CARTE DE LA CALIFORNIE Suivant I. la Carte manuscrite de l'Amerique de Mathieu Néron Pecci olen dresses à Florence en 1604 II. Sanson 1656 III. De l'Isle Amèrique Sept. 1700 IV. le Pere Kino Jesuite en 1705 V. la Sociètè des Jésuites en 1767 La Còte orientale depuis le C. des Vierges jusqu'à l'embouchure du R. Colorado est estraite de la Carte du P. Ferdinand Gonsaque dressèe en 1746.
items.attribution: This work has been identified as being free of known restrictions under copyright law, including all related and neighboring rights. You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: CARTE DE LA CALIFORNIE Suivant I. la Carte manuscrite de l'Amerique de Mathieu Néron Pecci olen dresses à Florence en 1604 II. Sanson 1656 III. De l'Isle Amèrique Sept. 1700 IV. le Pere Kino Jesuite en 1705 V. la Sociètè des Jésuites en 1767 La Còte orientale depuis le C. des Vierges jusqu'à l'embouchure du R. Colorado est estraite de la Carte du P. Ferdinand Gonsaque dressèe en 1746.

metadata.label: State 1
metadata.value: Inset maps “II” and “V” are unlabelled. Map [II] is with horizontal lettering for “P. de la Conception”. Map III with lettering but no land represented for “I. de Se. Catherine” and “I. de Cenica”; with “MER DE CALIFORNIE ou VERMEILLE” extending to 37 deg. N. with shading along the “R. de bona guida”; and with no top longitude lines except 235 and 240 deg. N. Within title cartouche, “1767” lettering has the 6 & 7 run together. Dimensions 29 x 38.2 cm.

metadata.label: State 2
metadata.value: All inset maps are labelled. Map II with horizontal lettering for “P. de la Conception”. Map III with lettering but no land represented for “I. de Se. Catherine” and “I. de Cenica”; with “MER DE CALIFORNIE ou VERMEILLE” extending to 34 deg. N., and with no top longitude lines except 235 and 240 deg. N. Within title cartouche, “1767” lettering is equally spaced. Dimensions: 29.5 x 39.2 cm.

metadata.label: State 3
metadata.value: All inset maps are labelled. Map II with lettering for “P. de la conception” curved upward. Map III with lettering and land represented represented for “I. de Se. Catherine” and “I. de Cenica”; with “MER DE CALIFORNIE ou VERMEILLE” extending to 34 deg. N., and with all top longitude lines labelled. Within title cartouche, “1767” lettering is equally spaced, but bottom paragraph has different line breaks: La Còte orientale depuis le C. des Vierges jusqu'à l'embou- |chure du R. Colorado est estraite de la Carte du P. Ferdinand | Gonsaque dressèe en 1746. With “164.” (bottom right). Dimensions: 29.2 x 37 cm.

metadata.label: State 4
metadata.value: Lettering, line breaks, and spacing as in State 3 but with no period after titles I, III, or V in the title cartouche. Lettering guidelines clearly seen throughout map. With “R.S” (bottom right) and “187=188” (bottom left). Dimensions: 30 x 36.1 cm.

metadata.label: Publications
metadata.value: Issued in atlas to accompany his: Diderot’s Encyclopedie, Paris, 1770. Issued in: Recueil de planches, pour la nouvelle édition de dictionnaire raisonné des sciences, des arts et des métiers, avec leur explication. Tome Troisieme. / Chez les Sociétés Typographiques. -- A Lausanne et a Berne, 1781.

metadata.label: References
metadata.value: Wagner 637; Wheat 160; Tooley 100; Leighly 177 (Plate XXIV, State 2); UCB.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Five representations of California on one sheet representing its delineation at various times, with view 'II' showing California as an island with indented northern coastline and many coastal place names. Suppl. 5e. Carte. (top right, above map).

metadata.label: Identifier
metadata.value: Original McLaughlin book number (1995 edition) with latest state information: 241-01

metadata.label: Relation
metadata.value: The Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island

none: Las sergas de Esplandian. El ramo que de los quatre libros de Amadis sale llamado Las sergas de Esplandian, hijo de Amadís de Gaula. Las quales fueron escriptas por mano del maestro Helisabad, poré fuessen manifiestos los grandes hechos que en armas hízo: segun que en el presente libro se cuenta.
Book digitized by Google and uploaded by ARLIMA (http://www.arlima.net)
